intro: Goniothalamus shraddhae, commonly known as the Shrivastava's goniothalamus, is a rare tropical shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Annonaceae, which includes many economically important trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It produces berries that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
